choices.B: This setup requires at least two firewall policies with the action set to IPsec.
choices.C: Dead peer detection must be disabled to support this type of IPsec setup.
choices.A: This is a redundant IPsec setup.
choices.D: The TunnelB route is the primary route for reaching the remote site. The TunnelA route is used only if the TunnelB VPN is down.

questions.question_text: To complete the final step of a Security Fabric configuration, an administrator must authorize all the devices on which device?

discussion.content: The answer is C. All devices must be authorized on the root Fortigate, and then after this step all must be authorized on the FortiAnalyzer.

Selected Answer: B
"The third step (AND LAST) in implementing the Security Fabric is to authorize the downstream FortiGate devices on the root FortiGate."

Reference: FortiGate Administrator 7.4 - Study Guide, page 389

When you authorize the downstream devices, you automatically authorize them in FortiAnalyzer.

Selected Answer: B
need to authorize on device first (from GUI) before authorize on fortimanager, so the answer is B

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

C is correct. "Final Step" is authorize Fortigate on Fortianalyzer. Authorize downstream Fortigates on Root Fortigate is required too but is the third step not the final one. Study Guide 6.4 chapter Security Fabric look for authorizing devices.
C is correct, fortigate study guide 6.4 p69

questions.question_text: If the Issuer and Subject values are the same in a digital certificate, to which type of entity was the certificate issued?

discussion.content: D is correct - traffic is denied by implicit firewall rule

choices.C: It matched an explicitly configured firewall policy with the action DENY.
choices.D: It matched the default implicit firewall policy.
choices.A: The next-hop IP address is unreachable.

discussion.content:
A is coorect :
